dashboard.control

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • acm.graphics.GObject
      • acm.graphics.GCompound
        • dashboard.control.Control
          • dashboard.control.Button
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    acm.graphics.GContainer, acm.graphics.GScalable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HoldButton, ToggleButton, TouchButton

    public abstract class Button
extends Control
    Provides the base functionality for a rectangular button with which the user can interact. The exact behavior of the button depends on both the specific subclass and the Runnables provided by the user.
    Author:
    Mark Sabini

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface acm.graphics.GContainer

        BACK_TO_FRONT, FRONT_TO_BACK

      Button(double width, double height, java.awt.Color baseColor, java.lang.String instr)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Button

        public Button(double width,
              double height,
              java.awt.Color baseColor,
              java.lang.String instr)
        Draws the Button's base and text, the latter of which is centered within the base.
        Parameters:
        width - the Button's width in pixels
        height - the Button's height in pixels
        baseColor - the Button's color
        instr - the Button's label, as well as its name in returned call hierarchies

    • Method Detail

      • setBaseColor

        public void setBaseColor(java.awt.Color baseColor)
        Sets the Button's color to the specified Color.
        Parameters:
        baseColor - the new color of the Button's rectangular base

      • setInstr

        public void setInstr(java.lang.String instr)
        Sets the Button's label to the specified String.
        Parameters:
        instr - the Button's label, as well as its name in returned call hierarchies

      • getBaseColor

        public java.awt.Color getBaseColor()
        Returns the Button's color.
        Returns:
        the Button's color

      • getInstr

        public java.lang.String getInstr()
        Returns the Button's label.
        Returns:
        the Button's label

      • resize

        public void resize(double width,
                   double height)
        Resizes the Button to the specified dimensions. This is used in adaptive widgets like ButtonGrid to automatically resize the constituent buttons.
        Parameters:
        width - the Button's new width
        height - the Button's new height

      • setOnAction

        public void setOnAction(java.lang.Runnable onAction)
        Sets the onAction of the Button to use the specified Runnable, to be run when the Button is depressed. When exactly onAction is executed depends on the specific subclass of Button.
        Parameters:
        onAction - a Runnable specifying code to be executed when the Button is depressed

      • setOffAction

        public void setOffAction(java.lang.Runnable offAction)
        Sets the offAction of the Button to use the specified Runnable, to be run when the Button is released. When exactly offAction is executed depends on the specific subclass of Button.
        Parameters:
        offAction - a Runnable specifying code to be executed when the Button is released
